channel.title: NASA Marshall Space Flight Center News and Features
channel.description: News, Images, and Features from NASA's Marshall Space Flight Center

item.title: Hinode Sees Annular Solar Eclipse from Orbit
item.description: On Oct. 25, the Hinode satellite used its X-ray Telescope to capture three passages of the Moon eclipsing the Sun.
item.source: NASA Marshall Space Flight Center News and Features

item.title: NASA to Provide Update on Artemis I Moon Mission
item.description: NASA will host a media teleconference at 12 p.m. EDT Thursday, Nov. 3, to discuss the status of its Artemis I flight test that will launch the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. The uncrewed mission will send the Orion spacecraft beyond the Moon and back to Earth before future missions with crew.
item.source: NASA Marshall Space Flight Center News and Features

item.title: Space Launch System Engines: Launching Artemis Astronauts to the Moon
item.description: This infographic labeled “Space Launch System Artemis II: Four RS-25 Engines” depicts the four RS-25 engines that are situated on NASA’s Space Launch System rocket for Artemis II, the first crewed Artemis mission to the Moon.
item.source: NASA Marshall Space Flight Center News and Features

item.title: Powerful Neutron Star’s Behavior Surprises IXPE Researchers
item.description: Observing its first accreting neutron star, NASA’s Imaging X-ray Polarimetry Explorer upends long-held scientific assumptions about the interior processes that drive these ultra-powerful celestial objects.
item.source: NASA Marshall Space Flight Center News and Features

item.title: NASA Invites Media to 2022 Wernher von Braun Memorial Symposium
item.description: NASA is inviting media to the 15th annual Wernher von Braun Memorial Symposium on Wednesday, Oct. 26 to Friday, Oct. 28, at the University of Alabama in Huntsville.
item.source: NASA Marshall Space Flight Center News and Features

item.title: Marshall Set to Demolish Former Headquarters, ‘Site of So Much History’
item.description: NASA Marshall’s scheduled October 29 demolition of Building 4200, its administrative headquarters for 63 years, will close a chapter of the pivotal field center’s history – and clear the way for new missions into the cosmos.
item.source: NASA Marshall Space Flight Center News and Features

item.title: From Student to Employee, How NASA’s Rocket Competition Launches New Careers
item.description: NASA’s Student Launch competition can equip students with the knowledge and connections necessary to pursue careers in the aerospace industry. This rings true for John Inness, a six-year participant of Student Launch now turned full-time employee.
item.source: NASA Marshall Space Flight Center News and Features

item.title: NASA’S IXPE Helps Unlock the Secrets of Famous Exploded Star
item.description: For the first time, astronomers have measured and mapped polarized X-rays from the remains of an exploded star, using NASA’s Imaging X-ray Polarimetry Explorer (IXPE).
item.source: NASA Marshall Space Flight Center News and Features

item.title: NASA’s Swift, Fermi Missions Detect Exceptional Cosmic Blast
item.description: A powerful cosmic explosion detected by NASA's Fermi, Swift, and other missions ranks among the most luminous events known.
item.source: NASA Marshall Space Flight Center News and Features

item.title: NASA’s Lucy Spacecraft Prepares to Swing by Earth
item.description: On Oct. 16, at 7:04 a.m. EDT, NASA’s Lucy spacecraft will skim Earth’s atmosphere, passing a mere 220 miles (350 kilometers) above the surface to gain some of the orbital energy it needs to travel to the Jupiter Trojan asteroids.
item.source: NASA Marshall Space Flight Center News and Features
